ratings.question_text: I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: What is the name of your TA?
comments: Stefan Renckens
Stefan Renkens
Stefan
Stefan Renckens

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: The professor should think about preparing more for classes. He often seemed both unprepared and uninterested.
A wonderful class. Presented a wide and difficult literature with clarity.

The course although very promising, did not leave to its expectations. The assigned readings were too much. There is no point in having student read over 100 pages per week if it is expected that student really understand the readings and are able to get something from them.

More time should have been spent at the beginning of the semester discussing the different institutionalisms. It seemed like the foundational aspects for understanding institutions were mentioned at the beginning but a strong discussion never emerged from it.Readings should be consolidated down to a reasonable amount. It seems more important to get a solid understanding of a few pieces rather than a very superficial understanding of a load of materials. This was corrected for by the end but it was a bit of a rocky ride at the beginning which made it hard to adjust by the end.Having two classes in one week is a nightmare. It makes it really stressful and difficult to complete the readings and to have them fresh in mind come time for class.
The open-ended nature of discussions was both the best and worst part of the course.

The open ended nature may have frustrated some people, but really that is because they weren't willing to engage the instructor and the material. By keeping the course open ended the instructor made the material more accessible to student interests. The people who embraced this seemed to be rewarded with an original and enriching experience.
readings were very interesting. Too bad i did not have enough time to read them thoroughly

I really enjoyed discussion. Despite the occasional silences the discussions were fairly engaging and there was a lot to discuss. Unfortunately, we read much more than we ever addressed in discussion.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: The professor needs to organize his thoughts and the course more. While I understand the benefits of a less structured seminar, the fact that so many classes needed to be rescheduled and that so many discussions ended up off topic suggests a lack of commitment by the professor to teaching. Sometimes it felt like this course was the professor's last priority.
More assignments would have been helpful in getting more feedback. As it stood writing four response papers felt a bit sparse. Perhaps increasing the number of response papers would have been better.

The instructor needs to show that he is truly interested in the course. It is not cool to miss reschedule four classes when the class only meets once a week.Also, because of the complex nature of the readings it is important that the instructor lays out the main concepts of each so that everyone can add to the discussion.
I think more time needs to be spent on figuring out the course material, particularly in terms of what readings are most important.The presentation for classes should have taken place earlier.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: Stefan was always accessible and quick to respond to email. Ben was often out of town and only occasionally accessible to students.

The instructor and TA always went out of their way to make time for the students. The instructor showed a lot of flexibility and care in ensuring that if people needed time that he was there to provide it. I never had trouble getting a meeting with him every time I needed to discuss course assignments.The TA was easily accessible and was very helpful in guiding me as to what to focus my attention on in the literature.
Ok. The instructor was helpful discussing the paper

Both the instructor and the TA were very helpful. The instructor is sometimes unclear, mainly because he speaks too fast and I think he makes certain assumptions about what is or is not understood. It makes it difficult to keep up and absorb all that he is talking about.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: This course helped me think about things from an institutional perspective, which really has helped me synthesize the results of my summer research.

The course focused on the major figures in the political science literature related to the environment. I am very interested in the intersection of these two fields so this course was awonderful addition.
It is a course with great potential. Unfortunately the way in which it is taught makes it frustrating.
Provides a new way of thinking about environmental issues and how different areas of the school frame issues. Interesting course to see how political science frames environmental management.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I mostly took this course to help me figure out a way to approach my summer research.
I wanted to learn more about the theory behind how government and social institutions impact the environment.
Because of the relevance of the topic to someone interested in environmental policy issues.
The instructor seemed like he had a lot to offer. There was a lot of energy in the room during shopping week so it seemed like a great learning environment.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Not really.
It did.
NO
The course was fine.

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: The classes were too unstructured and often led to discussions that were completely off-topic. The professor needs to do a better job of explaining readings before starting discussion.
I did.
No
I found a new way to think of environment however I don't find it particularly useful or productive.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: This course is extremely abstract and can be extremely frustrating.
Really try to engage the instructor and the material. There were a lot of ideas being debated in the readings and coming to the class well prepared was the key to having a good experience.
Unless, there is actual change, don't take it. You can do some of the readings on your own. or perhaps do an independent study
